isis.stitle: T 444E Diesel Engine Diagnostics (NAVPAK) (1997) - SECTION 3.5: ELECTRONIC CONTROL SYSTEM DIAGNOSTICS, ACCELERATOR PEDAL POSITION SENSOR/IVS SWITCH (APS/IVS) - BAROMETRIC PRESSURE (BARO) SENSOR - ECM DIAGNOSTICS

svcproc.title: ECM DIAGNOSTICS
svcproc.para: The ECM continuously monitors the signal from the BARO sensor to ECM terminal 29. If the signal is out of the expected range, a fault is logged (warning light does NOT turn on) and the ECM uses the Manifold Absolute Pressure (MAP) signal generated at low idle to determine barometric pressure.
ECM: baro signal out of range high
BARO signal greater than 4.95 volts for more than 1 second.

para.emph: BARO SIGNAL OUT OF RANGE LOW

svcproc.para: BARO signal less than 1.0 volt for more than 1 second .

Refer to Figure 3.21
for the accelerator, Baro, intake temperature sensor systems circuit diagram.

figure.caption: Figure 3.21 Accelerator, Baro, Intake Temperature Sensor Systems Circuit Diagram

note.para: * - Refer to CTS 5122V Electrical Circuit Diagram Publication

svcproc.para:
Refer to Figure 3.22
for the accelerator, Baro, intake airtemp systems and dual drive cab circuit diagram.

figure.caption: Figure 3.22 Accelerator, Baro, Intake Airtemp Systems And Dual Drive Cab Circuit Diagram
